{
    "number": 112650,
    "data": "10,166,43146,2805252934",
    "name": "Number of truth tables generated by (n-1)-CNF boolean expressions of n variables.",
    "comment": [
        "Conjunctive Normal Form (CNF) is a conjunction of disjunctions. k-CNF limits each disjunctive clause to k variables and their complements."
    ],
    "link": [
        "C. B. Barber, <a href=\"http://www.qhull.org/download/ttcnf-2005.1.zip\">ttcnf 2005.1</a> (April 2005).",
        "C. B. Barber, <a href=\"http://www.qhull.org/ttcnf\">www.qhull.org/ttcnf</a>."
    ],
    "example": [
        "E.g. The 1-CNF expressions of 2 variables are: a, -a, b, -b, a and b, a and -b, -a and b, -a and -b, a and -a, true. Their truth tables are: 0xC, 0x3, 0xA, 0x5, 0x8, 0x4, 0x2, 0x1, 0x0, 0xF."
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A109457, A112535."
    ],
    "keyword": "more,nonn",
    "offset": "2,1",
    "author": "Brad Barber (bradb(AT)shore.net), Dec 27 2005",
    "references": 1,
    "revision": 1,
    "time": "2006-01-24T03:00:00-05:00",
    "created": "2006-01-24T03:00:00-05:00"
}
